heading: the last train
subheading: a corpse rode a new york subway train for more than four hours monday before passengers noticed he was dead. authorities speculate that morning rush-hour commuters thought the unidentified man -- believed to be in his 40s, was sleeping. there were no visible signs of a struggle or attack.
author: wired staff
text: a corpse rode a new york subway train for more than four hours monday before passengers noticed he was dead. authorities speculate that morning rush-hour commuters thought the unidentified man -- believed to be in his 40s, was sleeping. there were no visible signs of a struggle or attack.
